bibl.title: Onias III' Death and the Founding of the Temple of Leontopolis.
bibl.note: Examines the role of the high priest Onias III in the events preceding the Maccabean revolt, and in particular his part, if any, in founding the temple of Leontopolis in Egypt. - See in part. pp. 83-86: examines a papyrus [C.P.Jud. I, 132] and an inscription [C.I.Jud. II, 1530 = William HORBURY and David NOY, Jewish Inscriptions of Graeco-Roman Egypt (Cambridge, 1992) No. 38] which refer to family history of the Oniads in Egypt.

bibl.title: Josephus and the History of the Greco-Roman Period. Essays in Memory of Morton Smith

bibl.seg: PARENTE Fausto, Onias III' Death and the Founding of the Temple of Leontopolis.
Fausto PARENTE and Joseph SIEVERS (Edd.), Josephus and the History of the Greco-Roman Period. Essays in Memory of Morton Smith = Studia post-biblica. 41 (Leiden - New York - Köln, 1994) pp. 69-98.

Examines the role of the high priest Onias III in the events preceding the Maccabean revolt, and in particular his part, if any, in founding the temple of Leontopolis in Egypt. - See in part. pp. 83-86: examines a papyrus [C.P.Jud. I, 132] and an inscription [C.I.Jud. II, 1530 = William HORBURY and David NOY, Jewish Inscriptions of Graeco-Roman Egypt (Cambridge, 1992) No. 38] which refer to family history of the Oniads in Egypt.
